review: I've had this device for about two weeks now and have been holding out before writing this review. I love the content available on it overall, but there are some definite exceptions. I don't know who has control over what content can be seen on this, but you would think, as I did, that movies that are 20 years old would be available with a Prime membership. I looked for a few of my favorites like Good Fellas, Casino, Scent of a Woman, The Godfather, Heat, Scarface, etc. and all are available, FOR RENT!!!! Who's in control of the content available on this device? Is it that since the more popular titles can still earn revenue from rentals, those in control won't let them be streamed?It would also be nice to be able to see some national news on this in real time. The CBS News app is not sufficient in this area. I am trying desperately trying to kick cable to the curb, but I am not sure this is the device that will help me do it. I also question the Prime membership thing. I can partner this up with Netflix, get the same content (actually more) and pay $9 more a year overall for the same thing. I'm having trouble distinguishing what the benefit is in having Prime for this device, (without regard to the shipping benefits for the things I buy from Amazon).All of that being said, I do like the Fire TV, it works really well and streams like crazy. My computer doesn't stream video as well as it does. Everything I watch is "instant on" with no hiccups or buffering; I couldn't be more impressed. The voice search works great, and the device overall leaves a small footprint in my space. This a great value for the price, and I will be keeping it, but will continue to try to get an answer to the questions I raised above.
author: Reid Patterson
